oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Impact of methionine nutrition on the leaf proteome of Lupinus angustifolius L. and Vicia faba L.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schumacher, Henrik
Gau, Achim Ernst
Klodmann, Jennifer
Paulsen, Hans Marten
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Cereals, pulses and oilseeds
Soil
Breeding, genetics and propagation
Knowledge management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Grain legumes possess a gernerally favourable seed protein amino acid composition but low contents of sulfur amino acids decrease their nutrient value. To enhance the methionie content of local grain legumes by plant breeding, phenotypical attributes for high methionine contents are required for the selection process.
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut - Bundesforschungsinstitut für Ländliche Räume, Wald und Fischerei
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schumacher, Henrik; Gau, Achim Ernst; Klodmann, Jennifer and Paulsen, Hans Marten (2011) Impact of methionine nutrition on the leaf proteome of Lupinus angustifolius L. and Vicia faba L. In: Rahmann, Gerold (Ed.) Ressortforschung für den Ökologischen Landbau 2010. Landbauforschung, no. Sonderheft 346. Johann Heinrich von Thünen-Institut - Bundesforschungsinstitut für Ländliche Räume, Wald und Fischerei, D-Braunschweig, pp. 25-32.
